001package com.github.tommyettinger.tantrum.jdkgdxds.helpers;
002
003import io.fury.memory.BoundsChecking;
004import io.fury.memory.MemoryBuffer;
005import io.fury.util.Platform;
006
007public final class Support {
008    private Support() {
009    }
010
011    /**
012     * This method should be used to read data written by {@link
013     * MemoryBuffer#writePrimitiveArrayWithSizeEmbedded}.
014     * <br>
015     * This should be replaced if Fury becomes able to read boolean arrays on its own.
016     */
017    public static boolean[] readBooleansWithSizeEmbedded(MemoryBuffer buffer) {
018        final int numBytes = buffer.readPositiveVarInt();
019        int readerIdx = buffer.readerIndex();
020        final int size = buffer.size();
021        // use subtract to avoid overflow
022        if (BoundsChecking.BOUNDS_CHECKING_ENABLED && readerIdx > size - numBytes) {
023            throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(
024                    String.format(
025                            "readerIdx(%d) + length(%d) exceeds size(%d): %s", readerIdx, numBytes, size, buffer));
026        }
027        final boolean[] booleans = new boolean[numBytes];
028        Platform.copyMemory(
029                buffer.getHeapMemory(), buffer.getUnsafeAddress() + readerIdx, booleans, Platform.BOOLEAN_ARRAY_OFFSET, numBytes);
030        buffer.increaseReaderIndexUnsafe(numBytes);
031        return booleans;
032    }
033
034    /**
035     * This method should be used to read data written by {@link
036     * MemoryBuffer#writePrimitiveArrayWithSizeEmbedded}.
037     * <br>
038     * This should be replaced if Fury becomes able to read short arrays on its own.
039     */
040    public static short[] readShortsWithSizeEmbedded(MemoryBuffer buffer) {
041        final int numBytes = buffer.readPositiveVarInt();
042        int readerIdx = buffer.readerIndex();
043        final int size = buffer.size();
044        // use subtract to avoid overflow
045        if (BoundsChecking.BOUNDS_CHECKING_ENABLED && readerIdx > size - numBytes) {
046            throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(
047                    String.format(
048                            "readerIdx(%d) + length(%d) exceeds size(%d): %s", readerIdx, numBytes, size, buffer));
049        }
050        final short[] shorts = new short[numBytes >>> 1];
051        Platform.copyMemory(
052                buffer.getHeapMemory(), buffer.getUnsafeAddress() + readerIdx, shorts, Platform.SHORT_ARRAY_OFFSET, numBytes);
053        buffer.increaseReaderIndexUnsafe(numBytes);
054        return shorts;
055    }
056
057    /**
058     * This method should be used to read data written by {@link
059     * MemoryBuffer#writePrimitiveArrayWithSizeEmbedded}.
060     * <br>
061     * This should be replaced if Fury becomes able to read int arrays on its own.
062     */
063    public static int[] readIntsWithSizeEmbedded(MemoryBuffer buffer) {
064        final int numBytes = buffer.readPositiveVarInt();
065        int readerIdx = buffer.readerIndex();
066        final int size = buffer.size();
067        // use subtract to avoid overflow
068        if (BoundsChecking.BOUNDS_CHECKING_ENABLED && readerIdx > size - numBytes) {
069            throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(
070                    String.format(
071                            "readerIdx(%d) + length(%d) exceeds size(%d): %s", readerIdx, numBytes, size, buffer));
072        }
073        final int[] ints = new int[numBytes >>> 2];
074        Platform.copyMemory(
075                buffer.getHeapMemory(), buffer.getUnsafeAddress() + readerIdx, ints, Platform.INT_ARRAY_OFFSET, numBytes);
076        buffer.increaseReaderIndexUnsafe(numBytes);
077        return ints;
078    }
079
080    /**
081     * This method should be used to read data written by {@link
082     * MemoryBuffer#writePrimitiveArrayWithSizeEmbedded}.
083     * <br>
084     * This should be replaced if Fury becomes able to read float arrays on its own.
085     */
086    public static float[] readFloatsWithSizeEmbedded(MemoryBuffer buffer) {
087        final int numBytes = buffer.readPositiveVarInt();
088        int readerIdx = buffer.readerIndex();
089        final int size = buffer.size();
090        // use subtract to avoid overflow
091        if (BoundsChecking.BOUNDS_CHECKING_ENABLED && readerIdx > size - numBytes) {
092            throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(
093                    String.format(
094                            "readerIdx(%d) + length(%d) exceeds size(%d): %s", readerIdx, numBytes, size, buffer));
095        }
096        final float[] floats = new float[numBytes >>> 2];
097        Platform.copyMemory(
098                buffer.getHeapMemory(), buffer.getUnsafeAddress() + readerIdx, floats, Platform.FLOAT_ARRAY_OFFSET, numBytes);
099        buffer.increaseReaderIndexUnsafe(numBytes);
100        return floats;
101    }
102
103    /**
104     * This method should be used to read data written by {@link
105     * MemoryBuffer#writePrimitiveArrayWithSizeEmbedded}.
106     * <br>
107     * This should be replaced if Fury becomes able to read double arrays on its own.
108     */
109    public static double[] readDoublesWithSizeEmbedded(MemoryBuffer buffer) {
110        final int numBytes = buffer.readPositiveVarInt();
111        int readerIdx = buffer.readerIndex();
112        final int size = buffer.size();
113        // use subtract to avoid overflow
114        if (BoundsChecking.BOUNDS_CHECKING_ENABLED && readerIdx > size - numBytes) {
115            throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(
116                    String.format(
117                            "readerIdx(%d) + length(%d) exceeds size(%d): %s", readerIdx, numBytes, size, buffer));
118        }
119        final double[] doubles = new double[numBytes >>> 3];
120        Platform.copyMemory(
121                buffer.getHeapMemory(), buffer.getUnsafeAddress() + readerIdx, doubles, Platform.DOUBLE_ARRAY_OFFSET, numBytes);
122        buffer.increaseReaderIndexUnsafe(numBytes);
123        return doubles;
124    }
125}
